instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B low <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with 1.4v on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is 3.7v and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> is 0v. 

CPU is getting hot. Removed removed <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> but CPU still getting hot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B low <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Did you check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
Possibly one high-side MOSFET from CPU power supply is fried.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B low <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B low <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Check <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR>/20 and <TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR>/60; at least one is shorted.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B low <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I removed one by one and checked CPU surface. Maybe 2 are shorted? Is there any other way of knowing ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B low <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B low <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: The short was in <TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR>. After replacing it the mac turned on for about 10min then shut down. <TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR> is shorted again. Charger and battery are originals. What could be causing this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B low <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Replace <CAPACITOR>C7551</CAPACITOR>.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7551</RESISTOR>/55 have correct values.
Also check all adjacent traces and solders.
